children.name: party a1
children.definition: party a social event, especially in sb’s house, when people talk, drink, eat, and dance: tiệc
examples: we’re having a party at my house. do you want to come?
did you go to stella’s party?
surprise party
we gave her a surprise party at a local bar.
a birthday/ halloween/ christmas/engagement etc party
over a hundred children came to the annual christmas party.
dinner partya party at someone’s house in the evening, when people have a meal:
i gave my first dinner party last weekend.
office partya party for people who work together
office parties are fun if you’re young, free, and single
fancy dress party[uk] /costume party[us] a party where people wear strange, funny, or historical clothes: vũ hội hóa trang
you’re invited to a fancy dress party.
cocktail party[a fairly formal party in the evening, at which alcoholic drinks are served] tiệc cocktail
i went to a cocktail party in the lobby of the ritz once.
invite sb to a party
how many people have they invited to the party?

children.name: get-together x
children.definition: get-together an informal party, often to celebrate sth: cuộc gặp gỡ, họp mặt
examples: shana’s picture won first prize, so we had a little get-together to celebrate.
a big family get-together

children.name: do x
children.definition: do  a party: bữa tiệc
examples: it was one of those dos where nobody really knew each other.
a bit of a do: bữa tiệc nhỏ
a friend of mine’s having a bit of a do in town tomorrow night.
leaving do for sb:who is leaving the place where they work: rời khỏi nơi làm việc
are you going to darren’s leaving do?

children.name: shower x
children.definition: shower  a party at which presents are given to a woman who is getting married or having a baby: tiệc mừng (sắp kết hôn hay sắp có em bé)
examples: we’re giving a shower for beth next week.
i want to thank both of you again for your beautiful shower gifts.
bridal/ wedding showerfor a woman who is getting married:
what did you give chris for her wedding shower?
baby showerfor a woman who is going to have a baby
we didn’t play any of the usual games at the baby shower.

children.name: bash x
children.definition: bash informal a big party: tiệc lớn
examples: the band are flying out to ibiza tonight for a huge four-day celebrity bash.
he had a big bash for his 18th birthday.

children.name: have a1
children.definition: have
examples: have a party/ get-together/ reception etc
we used to have a big christmas party every year.
the couple had their wedding reception at the museum of modern art.
mark, my boss, had a surprise party to welcome me home.

children.name: throw a party x
children.definition: throw a party to have a party at your home, often a big or expensive one, especially in order to celebrate sth: tổ chức tiệc, làm tiệc
examples: he threw a huge party to celebrate making his first million dollars.
throw a party for
the staff and patients threw a going-away party for dr rogers.
the krugers threw an impromptu cocktail party for him in the backyard.

children.name: hold b1
children.definition: hold tổ chức
examples: hold a party/ dinner/ reception/ function etc[to have a formal or official party]
the anniversary dinner was held wednesday night at the washington hilton.
they are holding a fund-raising reception on friday in the city hall.

children.name: give a2
children.definition: give tổ chức
examples: give a party/ dinner party/ lunch party etc[to be the person who organizes a party]
i’m giving a dinner party on thursday night. would you like to come?
on maggie’s last night in the house, jo gave a little farewell party.
give a party for sb
the prospect of giving a dinner party for my boyfriend’s snobbish parents filled me with gloom.
the last show of the tour was in atlanta, and i decided to give a party for the singers and musicians.

children.name: host c1
children.definition: host
examples: host a party/ dinner party/ reception etc[to be the person who organizes a formal party and officially welcomes the guests]
colette will be hosting a cocktail reception at 6.00 pm in the grosvenor suite.
last year, the city hosted a three-day gay pride festival.

children.name: entertain x
children.definition: entertain to provide a meal or social activity for sb in your home, either because they are your friends, or because they are people you work with: tiếp đãi, chiêu đãi, đãi khách
examples: this is an easy but impressive dish if you are entertaining at home.
about a fifth of their income is spent on entertaining clients.
we entertain a lot of people, mainly business associates of my wife's.
now that i live on my own, i don't entertain much.

children.name: entertain b1
children.definition: entertain to give parties, especially fairly formal parties, for people who are not particularly close friends, for example business customers: thiết đãi, chiêu đãi, đãi khách
examples: i meet a lot of people, but i don’t entertain much myself.
being a sociable person, eva loved entertaining.
an important part of the job is entertaining business clients.
do you get an allowance forentertaining clients?

children.name: host b2
children.definition: host (female alsohostess) the person who invites people to a party and provides them with food and drink: chủ nhà
examples: i was intrigued to learn that our chinese host had spent many years in chicago.
we thanked our hosts for the lovely evening.
hostess[c noun] a woman who invites people to a party and provides them with food and drink:
pam, you’ve been a great hostess - thank you.

children.name: guest a2
children.definition: guest sb who goes to a party: khách mời
examples: lily poured her guest a glass of sherry.
after the wedding, the couple staged a huge reception for over 250 guests.
guest of honour[uk] /guest of honor[us] the most important guest at a party: khách mời đặc biệt
this year’s guest of honour will be the novelist margaret attwood.

children.name: gatecrasher x
children.definition: gatecrasher/party crasher  sb who goes to a party that they have not been invited to: khách không mời mà đến
examples: lee says the damage was caused by a couple of unknown gatecrashers.

children.name: a special event at which you celebrate sth
celebration b1
children.definition: celebration an event such as a party or a special public occasion that is held because people want to celebrate something: kỉ niệm
examples: new year celebrations in scotland go on for three days.
there is a two-day citywide celebration each year at the end of june.
celebration of
the hospital is planning a huge celebration of its 50th anniversary.
birthday/ anniversary/ new year’s etc celebration
janine had her birthday celebration a week early.

children.name: function c1
children.definition: function a large formal or official party, usually for important people:buổi họp mặt chính thức
examples: the lavender room can be booked for functions or parties.corporate function for a company
his specialist service is in constant demand for big corporate functions.
as a mayor, he has a lot ofofficialfunctions toattend.
i see her two or three times a year, usually atsocialfunctions.
state functionofficial government party: buổi họp mặt chính thức cuả chính phủ
part of her duties is attending official state functions.

children.name: reception b2
children.definition: reception a large formal or official party, usually held to welcome sb or to celebrate sth:lễ chiêu đãi
examples: on the second night, the captain always holds a formal reception for the crew and passengers.
the pair were spotted together at a champagne reception at the imperial hotel.
attend a reception
two hundred guests attended an evening reception, held in honor of the chancellor’s visit.
wedding receptiona big party held after a wedding:tiệc cưới
the wedding reception will take place at the lennox hotel, starting at 3.30 pm.

children.name: go to u
children.definition: go to có mặt tham dự
examples: are you going to the christmas party?
over 150 people went to her 21st birthday party.

children.name: attend b1
children.definition: attend  to go to a formal party:tham dự
examples: the duchess of york attended the charity reception, along with her two daughters.
some of the most glittering celebrities in the country are expected to attend.

children.name: party x
children.definition: party informal to spend time enjoying yourself at a party or at parties, especially when this involves drinking a lot of alcohol, dancing etc: ăn tiệc
examples: they partied till 7 in the morning.
i could party all night long!
let's party!
they partied till dawn.

children.name: partying x
children.definition: partying the activity of drinking, dancing, meeting people etc at parties: tiệc tùng
examples: my life was an endless round of photo shoots, interviews, and serious partying.
partying and having a good time was all she seemed interested in.
around about 2 am, the partying came to an abrupt halt.

children.name: festival b1
children.definition: festival an occasion when there are performances of many films, plays, pieces of music etc, usually happening in the same place every year : lễ hội
examples: festival of
the swansea festival of music and the arts
a film/music/dance/arts festival
the movie won an award at the cannes film festival.
a rock/pop/jazz/folk festival
he's appeared at folk festivals all over europe.
a literary festival
the cheltenham literary festival.
a beer festival
the famous munich beer festival
an international festival
an international festival of drama and dance
a cultural festival
a cultural festival will celebrate the traditions of the local people.
have/ hold a festivaltucson had a film festival last month.
celebrate a festivalthe festival is celebrated each july.
go to a festival(alsoattend a festivalformal)
an estimated 20,000 people had attended the festival.
appear/play/speak at a festival(= perform at a festival )
sting is scheduled to appear at a festival in amsterdam next month.
take part in a festival(= perform there )
the school choir, which has taken part in the festival since 1980, is rehearsing every day.

children.name: nightlife b1
children.definition: nightlife entertainment and social activities which happen in the evening in bars and nightclubs.
examples: there isn't much nightlife at the resort-you'll have to go into the main town for that.

children.name: occasion b1
children.definition: occasion a special or formal event
examples: i’m saving this bottle of champagne for a special occasion.
sara's party wasquite anoccasion - there were over a hundred people there.
at the wedding he sang a song specially writtenforthe occasion.
i have a suit but i only wear iton specialoccasions.
the coronation of a new king is, of course, ahistoricoccasion.
on the occasion of something[formal]at the time of an important event : nhân dịp
congratulationson theoccasionofyour wedding anniversary.

children.name: treat c2
children.definition: treat a special and enjoyable occasion or experience
examples: we're going to italy for the weekend - it's mybirthdaytreat.
as aspecialtreat, i'll take you to my favourite tea-shop.
when we were kids, a trip to the beach was areal treat.

children.name: april fool's day
children.definition: (uk alsoall fools' day)
examples: april, a day when people play tricks on people then sayuk'april fool!'/us'april fools!'

children.name: halloween
children.definition: ,hallowe'ennounthe night of 31 october when children dress in special clothes and people try to frighten each

children.name: mother's day
children.definition: noun
examples: [ c usually singular ](uk alsomothering sunday)a day each year when people give a card or present to their mother or do something special for her

children.name: new year's eve
children.definition: noun đêm giao thừa
examples: the last day of the year
_are you having a new year's eve party?

children.name: valentine's day
children.definition: noun
examples: february, a day when you give avalentine cardto someone you have a romantic relationship with or would like a romantic relationship with

children.name: independence day
children.definition: the fourth of julynoun (formal)quốc khánh hoa kỳ (04/7/1776)
examples: a national holiday in theusthat celebrates the country's independence fromgreat britainin 1776

children.name: labour day
children.definition: uk,uslabor daynoun
examples: a public holiday which celebrates the worker
_may 1st is labour day in a lot of countries.

children.name: new year's day
children.definition: noun (usnew year's)ngày một tháng giêng; ngày đầu năm
examples: the first day of the year, which is a public holiday in many countries

children.name: thanks giving ( day)
children.definition: noun
examples: a public holiday and celebration, held on the fourth thursday of november in theusand on the second monday of october incanada, to remember the thanks that the people who first came fromeuropegave to god when they collected crops for the first time in their new country
